page.title: 09TRAFFIC CENSUS
page.content: On the 12 June we decided to carry out a traffic survey on the A360, the main Salisbury to Devizes road, which runs through Shrewton. We were divided into two groups, one group recording traffic travelling towards Devizes, the other group recording traffic towards Salisbury. We counted cars, lorries/vans,motor- bikes, bicycles,army vehicles,buses and pedestrians.We counted for 20 minutes starting at 1.45p.m. and 11.00a.m and multiplied the results by 3 to give the number of vehicles per hour. The position from which we counted was 13 miles from Devizes and 13 miles from Warminster. There is a chart combining both sets of results on the next page. Cars were the most common vehicle passing through the village,then vans and lorries,and then motorbikes.
